10  package de.funfried.netbeans.plugins.external.formatter.java.google;
11  
12  import java.util.ArrayList;
13  import java.util.Collection;
14  import java.util.SortedSet;
15  
16  import org.apache.commons.collections4.CollectionUtils;
17  import org.apache.commons.lang3.tuple.Pair;
18  
19  import com.google.common.collect.Range;
20  import com.google.googlejavaformat.java.Formatter;
21  import com.google.googlejavaformat.java.FormatterException;
22  import com.google.googlejavaformat.java.JavaFormatterOptions;
23  
24  /**
25   * Delegation class to the Google formatter implementation.
26   *
27   * @author bahlef
28   */
29  public final class GoogleJavaFormatterWrapper {
30  	/**
31  	 * Package private Constructor for creating a new instance of {@link GoogleFormatter}.
32  	 */
33  	GoogleJavaFormatterWrapper() {
34  	}
35  
36  	/**
37  	 * Formats the given {@code code} with the given configurations and returns
38  	 * the formatted code.
39  	 *
40  	 * @param code            the unformatted code
41  	 * @param codeStyle       the code {@link JavaFormatterOptions.Style} to use,
42  	 *                        if {@code null} the {@link JavaFormatterOptions.Style#GOOGLE}
43  	 *                        style will be used
44  	 * @param changedElements a {@link SortedSet} containing ranges as {@link Pair}
45  	 *                        objects defining the offsets which should be formatted
46  	 *
47  	 * @return the formatted code
48  	 */
49  	public String format(String code, JavaFormatterOptions.Style codeStyle, SortedSet<Pair<Integer, Integer>> changedElements) {
50  		if (code == null) {
51  			return null;
52  		}
53  
54  		if (codeStyle == null) {
55  			codeStyle = JavaFormatterOptions.Style.GOOGLE;
56  		}
57  
58  		Collection<Range<Integer>> characterRanges = new ArrayList<>();
59  		if (changedElements == null) {
60  			characterRanges.add(Range.closedOpen(0, code.length()));
61  		} else if (!CollectionUtils.isEmpty(changedElements)) {
62  			for (Pair<Integer, Integer> changedElement : changedElements) {
63  				int start = changedElement.getLeft();
64  				int end = changedElement.getRight();
65  
66  				if (start == end) {
67  					end++;
68  				}
69  
70  				characterRanges.add(Range.open(start, end));
71  			}
72  		} else {
73  			// empty changed elements means nothing's left which can be formatted due to guarded sections
74  			return code;
75  		}
76  
77  		try {
78  			Formatter formatter = new Formatter(JavaFormatterOptions.builder().style(codeStyle).build());
79  			return formatter.formatSource(code, characterRanges);
80  		} catch (FormatterException ex) {
81  			throw new RuntimeException(ex);
82  		}
83  	}
84  }
